cluster_classes.class_description: Geopolitical locations that host major sporting events and experience related economic impacts such as revenue and tourism.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: host cities and countries that generate revenue, create jobs, and boost tourism from major sporting events

members.entity_description: Cities that host major sporting events and experience associated economic impacts such as revenue and tourism.
Countries that host major sporting events and benefit economically through revenue and related activities.

cluster_classes.class_description: Large-scale sports events that bring together participants or teams from multiple countries and attract worldwide audiences.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: events that bring together millions of people from around the globe, transcending language barriers and political divisions

members.entity_description: Large sports competitions between teams or individuals from multiple countries.
A major international soccer tournament bringing together teams and fans from many countries.
A major international multi-sport event involving athletes from around the world.

cluster_classes.class_description: Sports and sports-related events with large international followings and significant cultural and economic impact, such as soccer and major sporting events like the World Cup or Olympics.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: World Cup in soccer or the Olympics are events that bring together millions of people from around the globe.

members.entity_description: Large-scale sports competitions that generate revenue, jobs, tourism, and broader economic activity for hosts.
A global team sport in which the World Cup is a premier international tournament.

args.justification: The entity 'major sporting events' is an event-type concept aligned with other international tournaments (World Cup, Olympics) in ClsC_480a20b7, while ClsC_d7c21bf5 should focus on broader sports phenomena such as the sport 'soccer' itself.

args.new_description: Large-scale international sports competitions and tournaments (e.g., World Cup, Olympics, major sporting events) that bring together participants or teams from multiple countries and attract worldwide audiences.
args.justification: After adding 'major sporting events' to this class, updating the description and assigning a shared class_group clarifies that this class is the canonical home for global sports tournaments and connects it to related location/phenomenon classes.

args.new_description: Geopolitical locations (cities, countries) that host major international sporting events and experience related economic impacts such as revenue, jobs, and tourism.
args.justification: This class describes cities and countries in their role as hosts of global sporting events, so assigning it to the same 'Global Sporting Events & Impacts' class_group links it with the events and related phenomena while keeping its location-specific scope.

args.new_description: Sports with large international followings and significant cultural and economic impact, such as soccer as a global team sport.
args.justification: Once the event-type member 'major sporting events' is reassigned, this class is effectively about the sport 'soccer' as a global phenomenon; renaming, updating the type hint/description, and aligning the class_group clarifies its focus on globally popular sports within the broader global sporting events ecosystem.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'major sporting events' is an event-type concept aligned with other international tournaments (World Cup, Olympics) in ClsC_480a20b7, while ClsC_d7c21bf5 should focus on broader sports phenomena such as the sport 'soccer' itself.

executed_decisions.justification: After adding 'major sporting events' to this class, updating the description and assigning a shared class_group clarifies that this class is the canonical home for global sports tournaments and connects it to related location/phenomenon classes.
